medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient has a 1-week history of intermittent abdominal pain, primarily epigastric and sharp, with radiation to the right upper quadrant and left upper quadrant. The pain has been gradually worsening over the past week. He reports early satiety and inability to move bowels. Initially believed he was just constipated. Presently, pain is increasingly worse with associated nausea and one episode of emesis consisting of regurgitated food.
